GeneralInformation.School Vision: A Distinguished Institution of Thinkers, Learners and Contributors
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture Beattyians of Character with a Sense of Purpose and Passion for Life
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Established in 1953, Beatty Secondary has nurtured many illustrious Beattyians. Its Alumni boasts of prominent members from the civil service, academia, business and the arts. Beatty Secondary believes in the unique worth of every student and aims to nurture resilient, team-spirited and morally upright individuals with a sense of purpose and passion for life. The broad-based academic and character development programmes offered at Beatty are specially tailored to ignite students' passion and interest in learning. They are also designed to develop and stretch student abilities and talents to the fullest. In all, education in Beatty Secondary seeks to nurture good thinkers and self-directed learners who will become contributing members of society. Underlying these programmes is the care the school provides for the physical, intellectual, social and emotional well-being of each of its charges. Beatty's team of committed and caring staff take pride in their innovative approaches in creating an enriching and supportive learning environment for her students.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: In Beatty Secondary, we nurture students to be Thinkers, Learners and Contributors. The school seeks to engage its learners through a varied and effective instructional curriculum and co-curriculum to help them develop the skills and disposition to navigate through life. Beatty's Applied Learning Programme (ALP), Beattyians Think. Create. Innovate Programme provides an excellent integrated platform for students to learn 21st century competencies for eg. in Critical and Inventive Thinking, Information Literacy and Communication and to apply these in real life contexts. To develop Beattyians of Character with a sense of Purpose and Passion for life, the school makes the Character development of students a key focus. Beatty's wide-ranging co-curricular programmes include outdoor adventure camps, the Values in Action programme, cultural exchange programmes with overseas partner schools eg Japan. These programmes serve to imbibe sound values, develop strength of character and socio-emotional competencies in students. Beatty's Learning For Life Programme (LLP), Leaders for Life Programme nurtures every Beattyian with leadership skills and disposition through a structured system of training, mentoring and opportunities at leading. Beatty's Key Programmes: MOE Higher Chinese Centre, Beatty Character & Citizenship Education, Overseas Twinning Programme, ICT Training Programme, Drama-in-curriculum, Subject-based Talent Development Programme, Elective & Advanced Elective Modules, Life Science Programme, Environmental Education.
